articles.title: ‘Extremely concerned’ about global aid cuts: Rockerfeller’s Raj Shah warns of millions of needless deaths
articles.summary: As major countries like the US, UK and France execute deep cuts to their aid budgets and turn a blind eye to climate change, the world will become less capable of handling a pandemic or a major food crisis, Raj Shah, President of the Rockefeller Foundation, said in an interview with CNBC-TV18. He warned that reduced global aid could cause 23 million deaths by 2030, affecting India. However, he saw some hope in private sector participation.

articles.title: January inflation at 2.75%: economists flag food risks, RBI likely to stay on pause
articles.summary: Sameer Narang, Head of Economics Research at ICICI Bank, said the shift in inflation trends is more notable than the headline print. He highlighted that food inflation has turned positive after months of deflation, while core inflation appears softer under the new series, particularly when gold and silver are excluded.

articles.title: New CPI series reflects changing spending patterns, may make inflation less volatile: CEA
articles.summary: CEA Anantha Nageswaran said the new CPI better reflects changing consumption patterns, may reduce inflation volatility, and improve monetary policy focus and budget predictability.

articles.title: India’s 10-minute delivery boom races ahead, but worker unrest exposes cracks in the platform story
articles.summary: As India’s quick commerce and food delivery platforms chase faster fulfilment and higher valuations, rising worker unrest is prompting difficult questions about sustainability, safety and the true cost of speed in the country’s platform economy.

articles.title: India’s new Consumer Price Index debuts February 12, January inflation likely near 3%
articles.summary: The revised CPI basket reduces the weight of food and raises the share of non-food items, potentially pushing January’s inflation print closer to 3% under the new series despite negative food inflation.

articles.title: India winding down Russian oil purchases, ramping up US energy buys: USTR Greer
articles.summary: India’s move to scale back Russian oil imports is emerging as a key pillar of the evolving US-India trade relationship, with Washington linking tariff relief and deeper market access to New Delhi’s energy diversification, tariff reductions and supply-chain cooperation.

articles.title: HPE India's Bhawana Agarwal on what the country needs next to unlock AI
articles.summary: AI operating closer to citizens can enable faster responses at hospitals, transport hubs and service points. Built on platforms such as Aadhaar, UPI and DigiLocker, deeper AI integration can strengthen verification, improve fraud detection and reduce delays across government programmes, writes HPE India Managing Director Bhawna Agarwal.

articles.title: India will grow the fastest among G-20 economies in FY27: Moody's

articles.title: Siemens bets big on India as rail upgrades, data centres and AI fuel next industrial boom

articles.title: Nykaa to take over Kiehl’s India operations in exclusive partnership with L’Oréal

articles.title: Scale, strategy and renewed confidence to power India’s M&A momentum in 2026
articles.summary: While the M A tailwinds are strong, 2026 will not be an indiscriminate upcycle. Regulatory scrutiny will raise operating costs and talent depth in leadership roles, especially in healthcare and tech-enabled sectors, which will make it harder for companies to scale in several micro markets, note Alvarez & Marsal India's Mohit Khullar and Nandini Chopra.
